Today's asymptomatic test pos. rate @UCSFHospitals: 2%. So 1/50 people w/ no symptoms of Covid is +.
At 2%, on flight of 150 people there's 95% chance that at least one passenger has Covid.
SF has a relatively low Covid rate, so odds on a US flight today are likely worse. #MaskUp

Ergo, if 40 people in Safeway,~48% chance at least 1 had Covid.
Most of the maskless folks will get lucky. But a few won't ‚Äì¬†getting ill, Long Covid, or catching/spreading to others. 
It looks like we're going to see what happens when many folks are "over it." Even in SF. (2/2)

Shopping @Safeway is def not in my "If I get Covid from this, it would've been worth the risk" category. Yet ~1/2 people I saw today in store in SF were unmasked. 
Asymptomatic test pos. rate @UCSFHospitals is now 1.6%. Thus ~1/60 people in SF who feel fine likely has Covid.(1/2)

...now doing. When I do something risky, I try to ask myself, ‚ÄúHow will I feel if I get Covid?‚Äù If the answer is, ‚ÄúI‚Äôd kick myself because it wasn‚Äôt worth the risk,‚Äù then I try not to do it. If it‚Äôs, ‚ÄúIt would've been worth it,‚Äù then I try to forget about C & enjoy myself.(15/25)

‚Ä¶ Your own risk preferences will influence your Covid choices.
5) I‚Äôve made it >2 yrs without getting Covid; I‚Äôd like to keep it that way. But today's risk-level may be as good as it'll get for the next few years, so we all have to find a set of behaviors we can live with.(6/25)
